skill.name: foundations-problem-solution-fit
skill.description: Problem validation and solution design. Use when discovering customer problems, generating solution hypotheses, or defining MVP scope.
skill.summary: Problem validation and solution design. Use when discovering customer problems, generating solution ...
skill.author: BellaBe

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only structured guidance and frameworks. Contains no executable code, no filesystem access, no network calls, and no external command execution. All static findings are false positives triggered by semantic misinterpretation of documentation text.

content.value_statement: Building products without validating real customer problems leads to wasted investment. This skill provides structured frameworks to discover, prioritize, and validate problems before committing to solutions. It ensures strong problem-solution fit before significant development effort.
actual_capabilities: Discovers and validates customer problems using Jobs-to-be-Done framework
Generates and evaluates multiple solution hypotheses with effort-impact analysis
Analyzes existing alternatives to identify competitive advantage opportunities
Defines MVP scope with clear success metrics and development priorities
Identifies unique insights and defensible advantages for 10x improvement
limitations: Does not conduct actual user interviews or gather primary research data
Does not build or prototype solutions - only designs and validates concepts
Does not access external market data or competitor information
Requires user-provided inputs like market intelligence and problem hypotheses

use_cases.title: Validate startup ideas
use_cases.description: Discover if your startup idea solves real customer problems worth paying for before building

use_cases.title: Define MVP scope
use_cases.description: Scope minimum viable product features that solve validated customer problems without overbuilding

use_cases.title: Find 10x opportunities
use_cases.description: Identify unique insights and defensible advantages to create breakthrough products

prompt_templates.title: Validate a problem
prompt_templates.scenario: Check if a problem is worth solving
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me validate that [specific problem] is a real problem worth solving for [target customer segment]. Use the Problem Discovery workflow to identify the problem, measure its frequency and intensity, and provide evidence from user interviews or market data.

prompt_templates.title: Generate solutions
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate 5 different solution approaches for solving [validated problem]. Evaluate each for technical feasibility, effort versus impact, and recommend the best option with build versus buy analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze alternatives
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze existing solutions to [customer problem] including direct competitors, indirect competitors, and manual workarounds. Identify switching barriers and unmet needs that create competitive advantage opportunities.

prompt_templates.title: Define MVP
prompt_templates.prompt: Define an MVP for [solution concept]. List core features that directly solve the validated problem, estimate development effort for each, define success metrics for launch, and identify pivot triggers if metrics are not met.

output_examples.input: Help me validate that personalized skincare recommendations is a real problem worth solving
output: Validated Problem Stack Rank: Can't find products for unique skin type (Severity: 5/5, Frequency: Daily, Evidence: 12/15 interviews)
Existing Alternatives: Manual trial and error (Satisfaction: 2/5), Competitor solutions lack personalization depth
Recommended Solution: AI-powered skin analysis with continuous monitoring
Unique Insight: Skin changes seasonally; one-time analysis fails while continuous monitoring wins

output_examples.input: What should be in our MVP for a project management tool?
output: Core Features: Task creation and tracking, Team collaboration workspace, Basic reporting dashboard
Nice-to-Haves: Advanced analytics, Custom workflows, Mobile app
Success Metrics: 40% activation rate, 60% week-1 retention, NPS above 30

output_examples.input: How do we differentiate from established competitors?
output: Competitive Gaps: Existing tools are complex with steep learning curves
Switching Barriers: Data migration complexity, team training time
Differentiation Angle: Simplify onboarding with AI-powered setup wizard
10x Better: Reduce time-to-value from days to minutes

best_practices: Follow the pain by focusing on high-frequency, high-intensity problems with clear evidence
Diverge then converge by generating multiple solution options before selecting one
Prototype cheaply by testing concepts with mockups before committing to build
anti_patterns: Asking Would you use X creates false positives; observe actual behavior instead
Solving problems you have rather than problems your customers actually face
Pursuing incremental improvements that cannot overcome switching costs in crowded markets

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides structured prompting frameworks.

faq.question: What inputs does this skill require?
faq.answer: Required inputs are market intelligence output and validated problem hypotheses from your research.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Receives market context from market-intelligence and provides validated problems to other skills.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution. All processing happens within your AI tool.

faq.question: Why is my output empty or incomplete?
faq.answer: Provide sufficient input context like market segments and problem hypotheses for best results.

faq.question: How is this different from market-intelligence?
faq.answer: Market-intelligence focuses on markets and competitors. This skill focuses on validating customer problems.
